titlestmt.subtitle: An inventory of his cartoons at Syracuse University
titlestmt.author: MM

list.item: 17 Sept 2009 - revised bio, added scope and inventory (SK)

bioghist.head: Biographical History
bioghist.p: George Dole (1920- ) was an American cartoonist and painter.

George Dole was born in New York City on July 24, 1920 and studied at the National Academy of Design, the Pratt Institute and the Art Students League of New York and began his career as a cartoonist in 1952. His work appeared in many prominent publications, including
Playboy, the
Saturday Review,
Pageant,
Cosmopolitan and the
Wall Street Journal with freelance writers providing the gags for some of the cartoons.
Dole, a member of the Magazine Cartoonists Guild, had his work exhibited in 1969 at the Sixth International Salon of Cartoons in Montreal.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents of the Collection
scopecontent.p:
The
George Dole Cartoons contain 25 original magazine gag cartoons. None of the cartoons are dated. Two are labeled for the
Saturday Review. One is labeled for the
Saturday Evening Post and one is labeled for the
National Enquirer. The cartoons are most likely from the mid to late 1960s.
The cartoons range in size from 7 1/8" x 8 3/8" to 10 3/4" x 15". They were drawn on board with ink and watercolor. One cartoon was done in color watercolor.

arrangement.head: Arrangement of the Collection
arrangement.p: Cartoons are arranged alphabetically by caption with four uncaptioned cartoons at the end of the collection.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Material
relatedmaterial.p: &scrc_name; has collections of over one hundred cartoonists. Please refer to &subjindex; for a complete listing.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: The majority of our archival and manuscript collections are housed offsite and require advanced notice for retrieval. Researchers are encouraged to contact us in advance concerning the collection material they wish to access for their research.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: Written permission must be obtained from SCRC and all relevant rights holders before publishing quotations, excerpts or images from any materials in this collection.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Preferred citation for this material is as follows:

did.abstract: ...And would you please refrain from using roman numerals in your zip code?; Courage sanity peace; Don't be rude Gerald. Sit somewhere else. This gentleman was here before us.; Don't worry it's a rotten apple.; For crying out loud, Angelo. Give up Tareytons!; Frankly, it was the tax aspect of this that intrigued me most.

note.p: "courage sanity peace" is a color cartoon.

did.abstract: He has a way with animals. They bring him nuts.; How did Harvard do yesterday?; I can't play now. The establishment says I have to do dishes.; I ran into a bit of luck.; I would like something to stop a gentleman from going to Lima, Peru.; Just a second.; Just why don't we fall off, Wendell?

Stop calling me mommie. I'm your Daddy.; Talk about deft.; Then I told her she had no supernatural powers at all.; Then you tink we've been too indulgent with him?; These kid parts are getting me down.; Why can't we have a car like everybody else?
You're not listening to a word I'm saying.; You're right Mrs. Davis, he is a lousy dancer.
